PT J
AN ZOOR15401000046
DT Article
TI New species and new data for the group of Dissochaetus brunneicollis and
   for the group of D. ovalis (Coleoptera, Leiodidae, Cholevinae).
FT Nuevas especies y nuevos datos del Grupo de Dissochaetus brunneicollis y
   del Grupo de D. ovalis (Coleoptera, Leiodidae, Cholevinae).
AU Salgado Costas, Jose Maria (jmsalgadocostas@uvigo.es) 
SO Bulletin de la Societe Entomologique de France
VL 121
IS 1
PS 51-64
PD Mar 2016
PY 2016
LA French
U1 0
U2 0
AB Three new species of the genus Dissochaetus Reitter, 1884, from Ecuador
   are described and illustrated. Dissochaetus intermedius n. sp. belongs
   to the group of D. brunneicollis (sensu Salgado, 2010); D. otongaensis
   n. sp. and D. giachinoi n. sp. belong to the group of D. ovalis (sensu
   Jeannel, 1936). Identification keys to species belonging to these two
   groups are provided. These three new taxa and other species mentioned in
   the manuscript significantly increase the known distribution area of the
   genus Dissochaetus in the Neotropical region.
C1 Salgado Costas, Jose Maria; Univ Vigo, Dept Ecol & Biol Anim, Campus
   Lagoas, Vigo, Pontevedra, E-36310, Spain, Spain.
EM jmsalgadocostas@uvigo.es
SC Zoology
SN 0037-928X
BD Systematics; Nomenclature; New taxa; Taxonomy; Key; Land zones;
   Neotropical region; South America
DE Dissochaetus brunneicollis group [Neotropical region /  / Key to
   species] [ /  / Biology; distribution; new record; systematics]. 
   Dissochaetus giachinoi; Dissochaetus intermedius; Dissochaetus
   otongaensis [Ecuador /  / New species]. 
   Dissochaetus ovalis group [Neotropical region /  / Key to species]. 
TN Arthropods; Beetles; Insects; Invertebrates
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Coleoptera, Polyphaga, Staphylinoidea,
   Leiodidae
OR Dissochaetus brunneicollis group (Leiodidae): [Key to species,
   Neotropical region, P. 55; New record]. 
   Dissochaetus giachinoi (Leiodidae): [Sp nov, Ecuador, P. 58]. 
   Dissochaetus intermedius (Leiodidae): [Sp nov, Ecuador, P. 52].

   region, P. 62].

DT Article
TI Anomalini and Anisopliini from Iran: new data and description of a new
   species (Coleoptera, Scarabaeoidea, Rutelidae).
FT Anomalini et Anisopliini de la faune d'Iran : nouvelles donnees et
   description d'une nouvelle espece (Coleoptera, Scarabaeoidea,
   Rutelidae).
AU Montreuil, Olivier (omontreuil@mnhn.fr) 
SO Bulletin de la Societe Entomologique de France
VL 121
IS 1
PS 105-110
PD Mar 2016
PY 2016
LA French
U1 0
U2 0
AB New collection records are given for ten species of Rutelidae from Iran.
   Anisoplia hivae n. sp. is described from Kordestan province and compared
   with its most related species. Two new synonymies are proposed:
   Anisoplia austriaca persica Petrovitz, 1980, n. syn. for A. austriaca
   major Reitter, 1898, and Anisoplia farraria antoniae Reitter, 1889, n.
   syn. for A. farraria Erichson, 1847.
C1 Montreuil, Olivier; Museum Natl Hist Nat, MECADEV, CP 50,57 Rue Cuvier,
   Paris, F-75231, France, France.

PT J
AN ZOOR15401000053
DT Article
TI New or poorly known Sericini of the Iranian fauna (Coleoptera,
   Melolonthidae).
FT Sericini nouveaux ou peu connus de la faune d'Iran (Coleoptera,
   Melolonthidae).
AU Montreuil, Olivier (omontreuil@mnhn.fr) 
SO Bulletin de la Societe Entomologique de France
VL 121
IS 1
PS 111-115
PD Mar 2016
PY 2016
LA French
U1 0
U2 0
AB The study of new materials led to describe two new species of Sericinae,
   Maladera kermanica n. sp. and M. khuzestanica n. sp., illustrated and
   compared with their most related species. In addition, new collecting
   data are provided for poorly known species of the genera Maladera
   Mulsant & Rey, 1871, and Omaloplia Stephens, 1830. Maladera (Eusericula)
   hivae Montreuil & Keith, 2009, is considered as a new synonym of M. (E.)
   jiraskovae Sehnal, 2008. M. (Cephaloserica) cardoni (Brenske, 1896) is
   recorded from Iran for the first time.
C1 Montreuil, Olivier; Museum Natl Hist Nat, MECADEV, CP 50,57 Rue Cuvier,
   Paris, F-75231, France, France.
EM omontreuil@mnhn.fr

   region; Eurasia; Asia

   record; systematics]. 
   Maladera (Cephaloserica) cardoni [Iran /  / New record]. 
   Maladera (Macroserica) kermanica; Maladera (Macroserica) khuzestanica
   [Iran /  / New species].

   113].

AN ZOOR15509054627
DT Article
TI Enchophora sanguiflua n. sp., a new neotropical species of Fulgoridae
   (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha).
FT Enchophora sanguifina n. sp., une nouvelle espece neotropicale de
   Fulgoridae (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha).
AU Audibert, Cedric (cedric.audibert@museedesconfluences.fr) 
   Porion, Thierry
SO Bulletin Mensuel de la Societe Linneenne de Lyon
VL 85
IS 3-4
PS 99-106
PD Mar 2016
PY 2016
LA French
U1 0
U2 0
AB A new Fulgoridae species is separated from Enchophora stillifera. If the
   populations of Panama and south of Costa Rica undoubtly belong to this
   species, those of Nicaragua, Honduras and Guatemala belong to another
   species here described. The type locality of E. stillifera given in the
   description (Mexico) doesn't correspond with the datas of the type
   specimen in the collections of the Rijksmuseum in Stockholm. It is most
   probably a lapsus calami for the data 'Chiriqui' which sounds very
   similar with some Mexican toponyms.
C1 Audibert, Cedric; Ctr Conservat & Etud Collect, 13 A,Rue Bancel, Lyon,
   F-69007, France, France.
EM cedric.audibert@museedesconfluences.fr
SC Zoology
SN 0366-1326

   Central America

   [Nicaragua /  / ]. 
TN Arthropods; Insects; Invertebrates; True Bugs
ST Animalia, Arthropoda, Insecta, Hemiptera, Homoptera, Auchenorrhyncha,
   Fulgoroidea, Fulgoridae
OR Enchophora sanguiflua (Fulgoridae): [Sp nov, Honduras, P. 101]. 
   Phrictus stillifera - Stal 1862 (Fulgoridae): [Type locality, Precision,
   p. 100].
